trans-unit.source: Create a Virtual Network
trans-unit.target: Create a Virtual Network

trans-unit.source: Walk through the steps to easily create a basic virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Walk through the steps to easily create a basic virtual network.

trans-unit.source: When you create a virtual network, your services and VMs within the VNet can communicate securely with each other without having to go out through the Internet.
trans-unit.target: When you create a virtual network, your services and VMs within the VNet can communicate securely with each other without having to go out through the Internet.

trans-unit.source: Creating a dedicated cloud-only virtual network is a relatively fast and easy process.
trans-unit.target: Creating a dedicated cloud-only virtual network is a relatively fast and easy process.

trans-unit.source: Because a cloud-only virtual network isn’t intended for cross-premises connectivity, you won’t need to acquire and configure a VPN device or authentication certificates.
trans-unit.target: Because a cloud-only virtual network isn’t intended for cross-premises connectivity, you won’t need to acquire and configure a VPN device or authentication certificates.

trans-unit.source: Once you create your virtual network, you can add new VMs and PaaS instances to it.
trans-unit.target: Once you create your virtual network, you can add new VMs and PaaS instances to it.

trans-unit.source: Note that if you use the Management Portal to create your VMs, be sure to select From Gallery so that you can specify the virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Note that if you use the Management Portal to create your VMs, be sure to select From Gallery so that you can specify the virtual network.

trans-unit.source: This is important because you can’t go back and put a VM in a virtual network after you’ve created the VM.
trans-unit.target: This is important because you can’t go back and put a VM in a virtual network after you’ve created the VM.

trans-unit.source: [Azure Note] Use this procedure to create a dedicated cloud-only virtual network. Because of the greater complexity involved with creating a cross-premises configuration, don’t use this procedure to create a virtual network that will later be connected to your on-premises network.
trans-unit.target: [Azure Note] Use this procedure to create a dedicated cloud-only virtual network. Because of the greater complexity involved with creating a cross-premises configuration, don’t use this procedure to create a virtual network that will later be connected to your on-premises network.

trans-unit.source: If you want to create a secure cross-premises connection between Azure and your on-premises network, see <linkText>About Secure Cross-Premises Connectivity</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you want to create a secure cross-premises connection between Azure and your on-premises network, see <linkText>About Secure Cross-Premises Connectivity</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Log in to the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Log in to the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: In the lower left-hand corner of the screen, click New.
trans-unit.target: In the lower left-hand corner of the screen, click New.

trans-unit.source: In the navigation pane, click Network Services, and then click Virtual Network.
trans-unit.target: In the navigation pane, click Network Services, and then click Virtual Network.

trans-unit.source: Click Custom Create to begin the configuration wizard.
trans-unit.target: Click Custom Create to begin the configuration wizard.

trans-unit.source: On the Virtual Network Details page, enter the following information, and then click the next arrow on the lower right.
trans-unit.target: On the Virtual Network Details page, enter the following information, and then click the next arrow on the lower right.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the settings on the details page, see the Virtual Network Details section in How to manage VNet Properties.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the settings on the details page, see the Virtual Network Details section in How to manage VNet Properties.

trans-unit.source: Name: Name your virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Name: Name your virtual network.

trans-unit.source: You’ll use this virtual network name when you deploy your VMs and services, so it’s best not to make the name too complicated.
trans-unit.target: You’ll use this virtual network name when you deploy your VMs and services, so it’s best not to make the name too complicated.

trans-unit.source: Location: From the drop-down list, select the desired region.
trans-unit.target: Location: From the drop-down list, select the desired region.

trans-unit.source: Your virtual network will be created at the Azure datacenter located in the specified region.
trans-unit.target: Your virtual network will be created at the Azure datacenter located in the specified region.

trans-unit.source: On the DNS Servers and VPN Connectivity page, don’t make any changes.
trans-unit.target: On the DNS Servers and VPN Connectivity page, don’t make any changes.

trans-unit.source: Just move forward to the next page by clicking the arrow.
trans-unit.target: Just move forward to the next page by clicking the arrow.

trans-unit.source: By default, Azure provides basic name resolution for your virtual network.
trans-unit.target: By default, Azure provides basic name resolution for your virtual network.

trans-unit.source: It’s possible that your name resolution requirements are more complex than can be handled by the basic Azure name resolution.
trans-unit.target: It’s possible that your name resolution requirements are more complex than can be handled by the basic Azure name resolution.

trans-unit.source: In that case, you may later want to add a virtual machine running DNS to your virtual network.
trans-unit.target: In that case, you may later want to add a virtual machine running DNS to your virtual network.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Azure name resolution and DNS, see <linkText>Name Resolution</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Azure name resolution and DNS, see <linkText>Name Resolution</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The Virtual Network Address Spaces page is where you enter the address space that you want to use for this VNet.
trans-unit.target: The Virtual Network Address Spaces page is where you enter the address space that you want to use for this VNet.

trans-unit.source: Unless you require a certain internal IP address range for your VMs or you want to create a specific subnet for VMs that will receive a static DIP, you don’t need to make any changes on this page.
trans-unit.target: Unless you require a certain internal IP address range for your VMs or you want to create a specific subnet for VMs that will receive a static DIP, you don’t need to make any changes on this page.

trans-unit.source: If you do want to create multiple subnets, you can do so on this page by clicking add subnet.
trans-unit.target: If you do want to create multiple subnets, you can do so on this page by clicking add subnet.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the settings on the details page, see the Virtual Network Details section in How to manage VNet Properties.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the settings on the details page, see the Virtual Network Details section in How to manage VNet Properties.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the settings on the details page, see the Virtual Network Details section in How to manage VNet Properties.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the settings on the details page, see the Virtual Network Details section in How to manage VNet Properties.

trans-unit.source: Because you aren’t going to connect this private virtual network to your on-premises network by using a cross-premises VPN configuration, you won’t need to coordinate these settings with your existing on-premises network IP address ranges.
trans-unit.target: Because you aren’t going to connect this private virtual network to your on-premises network by using a cross-premises VPN configuration, you won’t need to coordinate these settings with your existing on-premises network IP address ranges.

trans-unit.source: If you think you may want to create a cross-premises configuration later, you’ll need to coordinate the address spaces now with the ranges that already exist on your local site to avoid routing issues.
trans-unit.target: If you think you may want to create a cross-premises configuration later, you’ll need to coordinate the address spaces now with the ranges that already exist on your local site to avoid routing issues.

trans-unit.source: Changing the ranges later can be somewhat complicated and will often result in having to re-deploy your
trans-unit.target: Changing the ranges later can be somewhat complicated and will often result in having to re-deploy your

trans-unit.source: Click the checkmark on the lower right of the Virtual Network Address Spaces page and your virtual network will begin to create.
trans-unit.target: Click the checkmark on the lower right of the Virtual Network Address Spaces page and your virtual network will begin to create.

trans-unit.source: When your virtual network has been created, you will see Created listed under Status on the networks page in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: When your virtual network has been created, you will see Created listed under Status on the networks page in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Once your virtual network has been created, you can deploy to your VNet.
trans-unit.target: Once your virtual network has been created, you can deploy to your VNet.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to deploy a VM to your VNet, see <linkText>How to Create a Custom VM</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to deploy a VM to your VNet, see <linkText>How to Create a Custom VM</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to select From Gallery when creating a new VM in order to have the option of selecting your virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to select From Gallery when creating a new VM in order to have the option of selecting your virtual network.

trans-unit.source: Note that if you have already existing VMs and PaaS instances deployed, they cannot simply be moved to your new VNet.
trans-unit.target: Note that if you have already existing VMs and PaaS instances deployed, they cannot simply be moved to your new VNet.

trans-unit.source: This is because the network configuration settings are configured for them during deployment.
trans-unit.target: This is because the network configuration settings are configured for them during deployment.

trans-unit.source: You'll have to re-deploy them to the new VNet.
trans-unit.target: You'll have to re-deploy them to the new VNet.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about <linkText>virtual networks</linkText><title></title> in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about <linkText>virtual networks</linkText><title></title> in Azure.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add a Virtual Machine</linkText><title></title> to a virtual network.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add a Virtual Machine</linkText><title></title> to a virtual network.
